description:
Of PCB design applications for Linux, I have only found three which do strip-board PCB design. One has fancy graphics and other unnecessary features which make it slow and awkward to use, another has an approach would only appeal to users with a very specific requirement.

This is the third. It is a very professional and effective program which is undergoing regular development. It does exactly what is needed, has an intuitive user interface, good graphics but not so fancy that they get in the way and useful functions but not obscure ones. For integration with schematic design software it can import a netlist. The menus are available in eight languages. Highly recommended!
summary: The best strip-board PCB board designer available for Linux

description: Thank you for writing this app.
Looks great and I'd love to play with it! But it just shows a little splash screen which imediately closes :L
summary: Won't launch for me on Ubuntu 20.04 :(

description: ...up until it stopped loading in Ubuntu 16.04 within the last few days. Now I get a splash screen, then nothing.
Doesn't work on stock Debian 11/Gnome. Closes after showing a splash screen.

Works like a charm.

Ubuntu 20.04.3
Gnome 3.36.8

This is a great app for Tube Amplifier home builders. You can do a full schematic and even more useful a wiring diagram of your custom chassis layout. Wires are colored the way you want them, allows you to see your grounding scheme, output versus the input and preamp wires, so you can keep them far apart and avoid capacitive or inductive coupling before you ever begin your real build.

I love this app, I recommend to any serious hobbyist!
